summary:
Iceland is an island country located between the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. It's known for its unique geology, with volcanoes and geysers. The capital, Reykjavík, is home to many of its 380,000 people. Icelanders speak Icelandic and have a long history, with settlement starting around 874 AD by Norwegian chieftain Ingólfr Arnarson.

Over time, Iceland was ruled by Norway and Denmark. It gained independence in 1918 and became a republic in 1944. The country has a strong economy, with fishing and tourism being important industries. Iceland is part of the NATO alliance but has no standing army.
title: Iceland
